item.title: Remove Large Files Committed in Git
item.description: It's quite annoying when you committed large files to git specially if it's something that's something confidential. We'll relatively easy to do that. Just use the 'filter-branch' command in git as follows: 1git filter-branch --force --index-filter \ 2> 'git rm --cached --ignore-unmatch path/to/huge-file.mp4' \ 3> --prune-empty --tag-name-filter cat -- --all You should be seeing something like below: 1~$ git filter-branch --force --index-filter \ 2> 'git rm --cached --ignore-unmatch content/sync/files/public/2020-04/Bad_Luck.mp4' \ 3> --prune-empty --tag-name-filter cat -- --all 4Rewrite 8dfc744d18880f14dbc8fcd09f50c4bc3ede71 (1049/1091)rm 'content/sync/files/public/2020-04/Bad_Luck.
